messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] math reading
messages.msgSnippet: My girlfriend read it to her son last year.  They really enjoyed it. The author wrote more books.  I can t think of the names off hand. Do you know any other
messages.messageBody:
My girlfriend read it to her son last year. They
really enjoyed it. The author wrote more books. I
can't think of the names off hand. Do you know any
other books for chidren of 7 to 9?

Hazel
--- Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...>
wrote:
> >> I just read a book that my husband brought home
> called
> >> Math Power How to help your child love math, even
> if
> >> you Don't by Patricia Clark Kenschaft.
>
> Has anyone read The Number Devil (sorry, can't
> remember the author, it's not
> with me)? I really enjoyed it. It's one of those
> books that I read, and
> then I read it again, it was so much fun.
>
> brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] math reading
messages.msgSnippet: ... Has anyone read The Number Devil (sorry, can t remember the author, it s not with me)?  I really enjoyed it.  It s one of those books that I read, and then
messages.messageBody:
>> I just read a book that my husband brought home called
>> Math Power How to help your child love math, even if
>> you Don't by Patricia Clark Kenschaft.

Has anyone read The Number Devil (sorry, can't remember the author, it's not
with me)? I really enjoyed it. It's one of those books that I read, and
then I read it again, it was so much fun.

brenda
